awd_titl_txt: The Meteorological and Physical Characteristics of          Lightning
awd_abstract_narration: The SUNY-Albany detection network now consists of thirty                  direction finders recording most of the cloud-to-ground flashes from            Maine to Florida and as far west as the Mississippi River.  Several             research projects will be conducted to better understand the                    meteorological and physical characteristics of lightning.  These                include, for example, the luminosity characteristics of triggered and           natural lightning, the physical characteristics of lightning in the             "Lake effect" snowstorms and in the regions of moisture convergence             and cyclonic surface vorticity in severe storms, and an evaluation of           the reported positive lightning ground flashes recorded throughout              the year by the network.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, THE
